ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.dataClasses

Class Story

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.dataClasses.Story

  • public class Story
extends java.lang.Object
    Role: A container to hold story information. This includes id, author, title, description, the id of the first chapter, a collection of chapters belonging to it, the id of the phone it was created on. Note that all id's are stored as UUID's.
    Author:
    Stephanie Gil, Ashley Brown

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAuthor()
      Returns the author of the story as a String (or null is the story author was null).

      Example:
      Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
      UUID id = myStory.getId();
      System.out.println(id);

      Output would be: "author"
      java.util.ArrayList<Chapter> getChapters()
      Returns the chapters of the story as an array list of chapters.
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns the description of the story as a String (or null is the story title was null).

      Example:
      Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
      UUID id = myStory.getId();
      System.out.println(id);

      Output would be: "desc"
      java.util.UUID getFirstChapterId()
      Returns the description of the story as a String (or null is the story title was null).

      Example:
      Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
      UUID chapid = UUID.randomUUID();
      myStory.setFirstChapterId(chapid);
      System.out.println(myStory.getFirstChapterId());

      Output would be something like: "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7"

      UUID phoneId = myStory.getPhoneId();
      System.out.println(phoneId);

      Output would be: "123"

      UUID id = myStory.getId();
      System.out.println(id);

      Output would be: "title"

    • Constructor Detail

      • Story

        public Story(java.lang.String title,
     java.lang.String author,
     java.lang.String description,
     java.lang.String phoneId)
        Initializes a new story object without needing to specify an id as an argument. A random unique id will be automatically generated when this constructor is used, and it will be a UUID.
        Parameters:
        title - Story title
        author - Story author
        description - Story description
        phoneId - The android id of the phone the story was made on

      • Story

        public Story(java.util.UUID id,
     java.lang.String title,
     java.lang.String author,
     java.lang.String description,
     java.lang.String phoneId)
        Initializes a new story object by specifying an id as the first parameter. Usually used when making a story object that will be holding search criteria since you can specify the id of the story that you would like to search for. When making a story to hold search criteria, any field you don't want to include in the search has to be set to null.

        Example:
        To search for a story whose title is "the boss", construct the story criteria holder like this:
        Story criteria = new Story(null, "the boss", null, null, null);

        To search for a story whose id is "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7", build the story criteria holder like this:
        UUID id = UUID.fromString("5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7");
        Story criteria = new Story(id, null, null, null, null);
        Parameters:
        id - Story's unique id, must be a UUID.
        title - Story title
        author - Story author
        description - Story description
        phoneId - The android Id of the phone the story was made on

      • Story

        public Story(java.lang.String id,
     java.lang.String title,
     java.lang.String author,
     java.lang.String description,
     java.util.UUID chapterId,
     java.lang.String phoneId)
        Initializes a new story object from data taken from the database. Should only be used by the StoryManager class when making a new story from the data just retrieved from the database.
        Parameters:
        id - Story's unique id, must be a UUID.
        title - Story title, must be null or a string.
        author - Story author. Must be null or a string.
        description - Story description, must be null or a string.
        chapterId - Id of the story's first chapter, must be a UUID.
        phoneId - The android id of the phone the story was made on. Must be a string.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public java.util.UUID getId()
        Returns the Id of the story as a UUID.

        Example:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        UUID id = myStory.getId();
        System.out.println(id);

        Output would be something like: "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7"

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns the title of the story as a String (or null is the story title was null).

        Example:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        UUID id = myStory.getId();
        System.out.println(id);

        Output would be: "title"

      • getAuthor

        public java.lang.String getAuthor()
        Returns the author of the story as a String (or null is the story author was null).

        Example:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        UUID id = myStory.getId();
        System.out.println(id);

        Output would be: "author"

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns the description of the story as a String (or null is the story title was null).

        Example:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        UUID id = myStory.getId();
        System.out.println(id);

        Output would be: "desc"

      • getChapters

        public java.util.ArrayList<Chapter> getChapters()
        Returns the chapters of the story as an array list of chapters. If the story had no chapters, because of the way stories get initialized, an empty array list will be returned not null.

        Example call:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        ArrayList chaps = myStory.getChapters();

        chaps is now an empty array list of chapters.

      • getFirstChapterId

        public java.util.UUID getFirstChapterId()
        Returns the description of the story as a String (or null is the story title was null).

        Example:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        UUID chapid = UUID.randomUUID();
        myStory.setFirstChapterId(chapid);
        System.out.println(myStory.getFirstChapterId());

        Output would be something like: "5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7"

      • getPhoneId

        public java.lang.String getPhoneId()
        Returns the description of the story as a String (or null is the story title was null).

        Example:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        UUID phoneId = myStory.getPhoneId();
        System.out.println(phoneId);

        Output would be: "123"

      • setId

        public void setId(java.util.UUID id)
        Set the Id of the story. The new Id provided must be a UUID.

        Example call:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        UUID id = UUID.randomUUID();
        myStory.setId(id);
        Parameters:
        id - New Story id. Must be a UUID or null.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Set the title of the story. Title must be a string. Example call:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        UUID id = UUID.randomUUID();
        myStory.setId(id);
        Parameters:
        title - The new story title. Must be a string or null.

      • setAuthor

        public void setAuthor(java.lang.String author)
        Set the author of the story. It must be a string. Example call:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        myStory.setAuthor("new author");
        Parameters:
        Author - The new story author. Must be a string or null.

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Set the description of the story. It must be a string. Example call:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        myStory.setDescription("new descr");
        Parameters:
        description - New description. Must be a string or null.

      • setFirstChapterId

        public void setFirstChapterId(java.util.UUID chapterId)
        Set the id of the first chapter of the story (the chapter that will be always be displayed when a user begins to read a story in the view story activity). The new Id provided must be a UUID.

        Example call:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        UUID id = UUID.randomUUID();
        myStory.setFirstChapter(id);
        Parameters:
        chapterId - New id of the story's first chapter. Must be a UUID or null.

      • setChapters

        public void setChapters(java.util.ArrayList<Chapter> chapters)
        Set the chapters of the story. It must be an arrayList and should never be null.

        Example call:
        ArrayList chaps = new ArrayList();
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        myStory.setChapters(chaps);
        Parameters:
        chapters - Must be an array list of chapters and cannot be null. It can however be an empty array list.

      • setPhoneId

        public void setPhoneId(java.lang.String phoneId)
        Set the phoneId of the story. It must be a string. Example call:
        Story myStory = ("title", "author", "desc", "123");
        myStory.setPhoneId("785xx4");
        Parameters:
        phoneId - New phoneId. Must be a string or null.
